channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Montana miner laying off 700 as price for metal used in catalytic converters collapses
item.description: The price of the precious metal palladium was about $2,300 an ounce two years ago and has dipped below $1,000 an ounce over the past three months.

item.title: Friday's analyst calls: Moderna gets downgrades, GE spin-off a clean energy buy
item.description: A biotech stock and an energy company were among the names being talked about by analysts on Friday.

item.title: Oracle gives rosy growth forecast, sending the stock soaring further
Air Canada makes plea for government help as pilots demand wages it says it can’t pay
item.description: The union representing 5,200 pilots says Air Canada continues to post record profits while expecting pilots to accept below-market compensation.

item.title: UK regulator finds Vodafone and Three merger would lead to price rises, seeks remedies for deal
item.description: The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) said the Vodafone and Three U.K. merger would lead to price increases for tens of millions of custome...

item.title: Death cross looms for Micron stock, but analyst says slower growth is temporary
Hewlett-Packard boss says pursuing Mike Lynch’s grieving family for $4 billion was a ‘difficult decision’ done in ‘the best interests of shareholders’
item.description: Hewlett-Packard CEO Antonio Neri expressed regret for Lynch's death while doubling down on his company's legal battle.

item.title: European markets higher after ECB rate cut
item.description: European stocks were higher on Friday as investors continue to digest the European Central Bank's decision to cut rates.

item.title: Small-cap stocks beating S&P 500 this quarter as investors expect Fed rate cuts
FirstEnergy ordered to pay $100 million for its role in scheme to bribe state officials
item.description: Energy company at the center of a $60 million bribery scheme in Ohio has been ordered to pay a $100 million civil penalty.

item.title: Pro-Russian hackers reportedly crashed Taiwan Stock Exchange website on Thursday, local media reports
item.description: This was reportedly part of a DDoS attack on the Taiwanese government in retaliation for comments made by Taiwanese President William Lai.

item.title: Lumen's CFO executive talks AI, Verizon’s fiber deal — and meme-stock status
Not every company is struggling in China: Brands like Sam’s Club and Lululemon win over more ‘rational’ consumers
item.description: While most brands struggle with sluggish demand, a select few consumer companies are delivering gains last seen during China's boom times.

item.title: Most Gen Z Brits want to 'be their own boss' — but one expert says they'll face a reality check
item.description: The vast majority of Gen Z want to "be their own boss," and have no intentions of working a 9-to-5 job, a new Santander survey finds.

item.title: Adobe earnings report brings records, but stock falls as outlook underwhelms
